analyzed: dbang po thul ba'i phyir dang / chos don gcig tu byed pas 'bras bu smad pa spyad pa la ma chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the control of the senses and because of the single-minded pursuit of the goal of Dharma, there is no attachment to the enjoyment of the results of action.

original: 'dis ni nor gyi 'dod pa la chags pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni nor gyi 'dod pa la chags pa med par bstan te /
translated: This shows the absence of attachment to the desire for wealth.

original: 'bras bu zhes smos pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes smos pas so //
translated: The word results shows that.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: thub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thub pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the Muni.

original: chos don gcig tu byed ces bya ba de'i rgyu yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos don gcig tu byed ces bya ba de'i rgyu yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: The single-minded pursuit of the goal of Dharma shows the cause of that.

original: rang gi don las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don las brtsams pa'o //
translated: It begins with one's own goal.

original: da ni gzhan gyi rgyu las kyang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi rgyu las kyang smras pa yin te /
translated: Now it is said of the other,

original: gzhan gyi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with the characteristics of the other.

original: skye dgu rnams zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //üîΩgtso bo rnams kyi spyod pa ni gtso bo'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so // gtso bo rnams kyi spyod pa ni gtso bo'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with the word people.üîΩThe conduct of the chief people is the conduct of the chief people.

original: de'i rjes ni gtso bo'i spyod pa'i rjes te /
analyzed: de'i rjes ni gtso bo'i spyod pa'i rjes te /
translated: The subsequent part is the subsequent part of the conduct of the chief people.

original: sgrub pa gang la yod pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo'i rjes spyod rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang la yod pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo'i rjes spyod rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the practice is the natural practice of the principal.

original: gtso bo ni khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: The principal is the one who is preeminent.üîΩThe two verses beginning with ‚ÄúHe gives his all to all beings‚Äù

original: sngar bstan pa'i chos don gcig tu spyod pa dang / dngos po kun gyis 'gro la phan byed pa //üîΩzhes pa de gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i chos don gcig tu spyod pa dang / dngos po kun gyis 'gro la phan byed pa // zhes pa de gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: indicate the two topics taught above: the practice of the one meaning and the benefit to beings through all things.

original: nor yang byin zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: nor yang byin zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúHe gives his wealth‚Äù is stated.

original: tshigs bcad 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te pha rol tu phyin pa drug @211a * //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te pha rol tu phyin pa drug @211a * //
translated: This verse shows the six perfections beginning with the benefit of self and other.

original: bstan to // sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pas ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan to // sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pas ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: By means of giving, morality, and patience, there is the perfection of the benefit of self,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni longs spyod kyi bdag nyid srid pa'i g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni longs spyod kyi bdag nyid srid pa'i g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the three perfections of giving, etc. are the cause for the perfection of the enjoyments of the world and the retinue of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i don yang spyod ces bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don yang spyod ces bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of effort.

original: 'gro la phan sems mthong na zhi bar snang //
analyzed: 'gro la phan sems mthong na zhi bar snang //
translated: When he sees the thought of helping the world, he appears to be at peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye dgu rnams la phan pas na 'gro la phan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye dgu rnams la phan pas na 'gro la phan pa'o //
translated: He is helpful to the world because he helps the world.

original: 'gro ba'i don la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yod pa ni 'gro la phan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yod pa ni 'gro la phan pa'i sems so //
translated: He has the superior thought of helping the world, so he has the thought of helping the world.

original: de mthong na zhi bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro la phan sems mthong na zhi bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de mthong na zhi bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro la phan sems mthong na zhi bar snang ba ste /
translated: When he sees that, he appears to be at peace.

original: 'dis ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of meditation and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems zhes bya ba smos pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba smos pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúthought,‚Äù he shows the aspect of skill in means.

original: mkhas pa'i rnam pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i rnam pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: The aspect of skill is wisdom.

original: de yang sems rtse gcig pas byas par bstan pa'i phyir gnyi ga smos so //
analyzed: de yang sems rtse gcig pas byas par bstan pa'i phyir gnyi ga smos so //
translated: And both are mentioned in order to show that it is done with one-pointed thought.

original: don yang sbyod  ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: don yang sbyod  ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: And the word ‚Äúto apply‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúto apply oneself to the welfare of beings‚Äù indicates the perfection of effort, which is the perfection of application.

original: 'gro la phan sems zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'gro la phan sems zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith the intention to benefit beings‚Äù indicates the perfection of aspiration,

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: and the phrase ‚Äúwith the perfection of meditative absorption and wisdom‚Äù indicates the perfection of the two perfections of meditative absorption and wisdom.

original: bag med pa'i dbang gis kha cig tu than pa 'byung bas 'khrug cing gnod par gyur to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag med pa'i dbang gis kha cig tu than pa 'byung bas 'khrug cing gnod par gyur to zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes, because of the power of carelessness, there is drought and the world is disturbed and harmed.‚Äù

original: char 'bab mi mkhas pas kha cig tu than pa 'byung ba des 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: char 'bab mi mkhas pas kha cig tu than pa 'byung ba des 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Because of the ineptitude of the one who sends down the rain, sometimes there is drought and the world is disturbed.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: Who is disturbed?

original: sems can rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams so //
translated: Sentient beings.

original: chos legs par ma spyad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos legs par ma spyad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of not practicing the Dharma well.‚Äù

original: ngan par spyad pa ni legs par ma spyad pa ste /
analyzed: ngan par spyad pa ni legs par ma spyad pa ste /
translated: Not practicing well is not practicing properly.

original: de bas na ma rungs par gyur pa ni goms par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma rungs par gyur pa ni goms par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause of not practicing well‚Äù means because of not practicing properly.

original: de'i sdug bsngal ni 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal ni 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of that is the suffering of the world.

original: de las thar par bya ba'i thabs ni skye dgu rnams sdug bsngal las 'don pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de las thar par bya ba'i thabs ni skye dgu rnams sdug bsngal las 'don pa'i thabs so //
translated: The means of liberation is the means of liberating living beings from suffering.

original: rnam pa du ma'i srog chags dag ni srog chags du ma'o //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma'i srog chags dag ni srog chags du ma'o //
translated: Many kinds of living beings are many living beings.

original: de dag gsod cing 'jigs 'jigs skad zer ba'i srog chags du ma gsod par rtsom pa de gang du gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: de dag gsod cing 'jigs 'jigs skad zer ba'i srog chags du ma gsod par rtsom pa de gang du gnod sbyin no //
translated: Those who are about to kill them, who are about to kill many living beings who are crying out in fear, are those who are about to kill many living beings who are crying out in fear.

original: yid la 'bab pa @211b zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yid la 'bab pa @211b zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'o //
translated: What is pleasing to the mind is the intention.

original: ngo zlogs phod pa nyid tshig rtsub pa yin pas ngo zlogs phod pa'i tshig rtsub po //
analyzed: ngo zlogs phod pa nyid tshig rtsub pa yin pas ngo zlogs phod pa'i tshig rtsub po //
translated: Harsh speech is the ability to speak harshly.

original: yang na do zlogs phod pa'am tshig rtsub po ni ngo zlogs phod pa'i tshig rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na do zlogs phod pa'am tshig rtsub po ni ngo zlogs phod pa'i tshig rtsub pa'o //
translated: Or, the ability to speak harshly or harshly is harsh speech.

original: sel bar byed pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sel bar byed pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: Cutting off is cutting.

original: chos kyi gtam nyid ni chos kyi gtam mo ;
analyzed: chos kyi gtam nyid ni chos kyi gtam mo ;
translated: Dharma talk itself is dharma talk.

original: / chos kyi gtam gyi skabs ni chos kyi gtam bya ba'i skabs te /
analyzed: / chos kyi gtam gyi skabs ni chos kyi gtam bya ba'i skabs te /
translated: The occasion for dharma talk is the occasion for giving a dharma talk.

original: de'i skabs kyi go skabs rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi gtam bya ba'i skabs rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i skabs kyi go skabs rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi gtam bya ba'i skabs rnyed pa'o //
translated: The opportunity that is found in that occasion is the opportunity that is found for giving a dharma talk.

original: bsam pa ni mngon par sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni mngon par sems pa'o //
translated: Intention is the mental factor of intention.

original: gang du dus las mi 'da' ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa yongs su srung bar byed pa de'i tshe snying rje bas so //
analyzed: gang du dus las mi 'da' ba ni gang gi tshe dmigs pa yongs su srung bar byed pa de'i tshe snying rje bas so //
translated: Not transgressing the occasion is not transgressing the occasion when one is protecting the object, out of compassion.

original: de dag sa gzhi legs par yongs su skyong ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni bgyi ba ste /
analyzed: de dag sa gzhi legs par yongs su skyong ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni bgyi ba ste /
translated: Whatever is the activity of properly protecting the earth, that is what should be done.

original: bgyi ba las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bgyi ba las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: Not transgressing what should be done is not transgressing the occasion.

original: rim pa gang gis bya ba de ni dus las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa gang gis bya ba de ni dus las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: The stage by which that activity is done is not transgressing the occasion.

original: chos dang bde ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dus las kyang mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: chos dang bde ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dus las kyang mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: Like the Dharma and happiness is not transgressing the occasion.

original: de dag gi chos dang bde ba rnams las mi 'da' ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi chos dang bde ba rnams las mi 'da' ba de bzhin no //
translated: Not transgressing the Dharma and happiness of those is like that.

original: 'khor gsum bstan la mkhas par gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba bstan ma thag pa'i tshigs bcad du ji skad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum bstan la mkhas par gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba bstan ma thag pa'i tshigs bcad du ji skad bshad pa'o //
translated: Skilled in teaching the three spheres is as explained in the just-taught verse.

original: de bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du //
translated: Similarly,

original: 'bangs la phan phyir gnam ru bsnams pa de //
analyzed: 'bangs la phan phyir gnam ru bsnams pa de //
translated: For the sake of benefiting the people, he plays the conch.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: lta ba ngan pas nyams pa'i skye dgu dag / ci'i phyir yal bar dor zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pas nyams pa'i skye dgu dag / ci'i phyir yal bar dor zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The verse Why do you abandon the people who are ruined by bad views? should be applied here.

original: mtho ris 'dod pas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is taught for the sake of those who desire heaven.

original: mtho ris them skas zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi lam mo //
analyzed: mtho ris them skas zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi lam mo //
translated: The stairway to heaven is the path to heaven.

original: bag med pa nyid lam yin pas bag med pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: bag med pa nyid lam yin pas bag med pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The power of heedlessness is the path.

original: mtho ris kyi them skas de la bag med pa'i dbang gis yun ring por lhan cig tu bag med pa'i dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi them skas de la bag med pa'i dbang gis yun ring por lhan cig tu bag med pa'i dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: On that stairway to heaven, through the power of heedlessness, they become heedless for a long time.

original: bag med pa'i dbang gis ni mchod sbyin bya ba'i dus las 'das pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: bag med pa'i dbang gis ni mchod sbyin bya ba'i dus las 'das pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Through the power of heedlessness, they pass beyond the time of performing sacrifices.

original: khyod kyi bka' ni zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di brtsams pa ni gal te 'di ltar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi bka' ni zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di brtsams pa ni gal te 'di ltar yang 'gyur te /
translated: This verse beginning with the line Your words... is composed for the sake of those who think thus:

original: ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa dang lhag ma yod do zhes pa med pa de med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa dang lhag ma yod do zhes pa med pa de med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is like this, then the desire to attain what has not been attained and the remainder exist, and that non-existence is taught.

original: yang na stobs dang ldan pas kun nas rnam par 'gal ba de med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na stobs dang ldan pas kun nas rnam par 'gal ba de med pa ste /
translated: Or, by the powerful one, that non-existence is completely contradictory.

original: mchod sbyin dang 'gal bar brtsams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mchod sbyin dang 'gal bar brtsams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and he does not act contrary to the sacrifice.

original: yang na @212a * //
analyzed: yang na @212a * //
translated: Or else,

original: yongs su srung ba rnam par spel ba'i skabs thob pa'i ngo bo bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su srung ba rnam par spel ba'i skabs thob pa'i ngo bo bstan te /
translated: the essence of the occasion of the increase of protection is taught.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal phran dag bka' bzhin du byed pa de dang las gang thob pa la sogs rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal phran dag bka' bzhin du byed pa de dang las gang thob pa la sogs rnyed pa'o //
translated: Because the vassal kings act according to his word, he obtains the results of the actions of the vassal kings.

original: yongs su srung ba las byung ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su srung ba las byung ba yang bstan to //
translated: The origination of protection is also taught.

original: da ni stegs mang po la sgrub pa tsam gyis lhag ma de'i skabs 'di zhes bstan to //
analyzed: da ni stegs mang po la sgrub pa tsam gyis lhag ma de'i skabs 'di zhes bstan to //
translated: Now, the mere establishment of the many means in this occasion of the remainder is taught.

original: legs pa dag ces bya ba ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: legs pa dag ces bya ba ni bsod nams te /
translated: The good is merit.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pas stegs la rab tu sgrub pa ni legs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pas stegs la rab tu sgrub pa ni legs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Because it is the cause of high rebirth, the establishment of the means is called good.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu chen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu chen po nyid do //
translated: This is the great result in the next world.

original: grags 'bar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: grags 'bar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The burning of fame is the result in the present life.

original: dus la bab ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bag med dbang gyur zhes bya ba de'i gnyen pos dus de las mi 'da' bas las la gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: dus la bab ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i bag med dbang gyur zhes bya ba de'i gnyen pos dus de las mi 'da' bas las la gzung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase when the time comes means that one should be attentive to one's actions by not transgressing that time through the antidote to the heedlessness mentioned earlier.

original: sbyin pa mdzad cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa mdzad cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: This verse beginning with the words generous is to be understood as follows:

original: rtag tu dbang bskur zhing rgyun du dbang bskur ba nyid de /
analyzed: rtag tu dbang bskur zhing rgyun du dbang bskur ba nyid de /
translated: Always consecrated means always consecrated.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of possessing generosity and morality.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni bya ba gzhan dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni bya ba gzhan dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nevertheless is for the purpose of teaching other activities.

original: dbang bskur kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang bskur bar gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: dbang bskur kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang bskur bar gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even though consecrated means that even though one has been consecrated.

original: lha yi bu lon bral bar mdzad pa'i rigs//
analyzed: lha yi bu lon bral bar mdzad pa'i rigs//
translated: The son of the gods is freed from debt.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i dbang du byas nas brtsams pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i dbang du byas nas brtsams pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the difference in the undertaking in terms of accomplishing one's own goal.

original: da ni skye dgu rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i dbang du byas nas mchod sbyin legs par bgyis pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad do //
analyzed: da ni skye dgu rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'grub pa'i dbang du byas nas mchod sbyin legs par bgyis pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad do //
translated: Now, with reference to the perfection of the people, there is the verse:üîΩBy performing a good sacrifice, for the sake of the people, for the sake of oneself, for the sake of fame, and for the sake of heaven, one should sacrifice.

original: de bas 'bangs la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin legs par byas pas lha mnyes par gyur te char grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas 'bangs la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin legs par byas pas lha mnyes par gyur te char grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the people means that by performing a good sacrifice, the gods are pleased and rain falls.

original: bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgra las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgra las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: For the sake of oneself means that one is freed from enemies.

original: grags par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis kar grags par 'gyur ba nyid kyi mchod sbyin gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: grags par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gnyis kar grags par 'gyur ba nyid kyi mchod sbyin gyi cho ga'o //
translated: For the sake of fame means that the rite of sacrifice is famous in both places.

original: gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa ni gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa ni gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa'o //
translated: Being dependent on others is being dependent on others.

original: yang na gzhan gyis bkrir rung ba ni gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis bkrir rung ba ni gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa ste /
translated: Or, being led by others is being dependent on others.

original: dad pa skye ba la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa skye ba la rag lus pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on the arising of faith.

original: blo chung ba'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dring la 'jog cing blo chung ba'i 'gro @212b ba'o ;
analyzed: blo chung ba'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dring la 'jog cing blo chung ba'i 'gro @212b ba'o ;
translated: That which is the going of those with little intelligence is being dependent on others and going with little intelligence.

original: / spyod mi nus pa ni rig pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sems med pas so //
analyzed: / spyod mi nus pa ni rig pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sems med pas so //
translated: The one who is unable to practice is the one who does not have a mind that is established in knowledge.

original: chos tsam la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chos tsam la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who delights in the Dharma alone is the one who desires merit.

original: chos ni 'dir chos kyi 'bras bu la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'dir chos kyi 'bras bu la rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the Dharma should be understood as the result of the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten dag na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni tshad mar byas na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni tshad mar byas na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: This verse on the one who is a source of harm to many people when he is taken as an authority:

original: long bas bstan pa'i long ba'i skye bo bzhin no //
analyzed: long bas bstan pa'i long ba'i skye bo bzhin no //
translated: He is like a blind man who is led by another blind man.

original: ngan song mi bde dogs pa'i nang na 'khod //
analyzed: ngan song mi bde dogs pa'i nang na 'khod //
translated: He is surrounded by the fear of the lower realms and unhappiness.

original: ces bya ba ni bsod pa ni chos su sbyor ba'i byed pa po de nyid kyang ngan song mi bde ba dogs pa'i nang na 'khod par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsod pa ni chos su sbyor ba'i byed pa po de nyid kyang ngan song mi bde ba dogs pa'i nang na 'khod par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the one who is engaged in the Dharma as a means to merit is surrounded by the fear of the lower realms and unhappiness.

original: da ni de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to establish that,

original: phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga smos te /
analyzed: phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga smos te /
translated: there are five verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe one who kills cattle.‚Äù

original: de las phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni dam bcas pa'i tshigs bcad de sgrub pa'i rjes su bstan pas so //
analyzed: de las phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni dam bcas pa'i tshigs bcad de sgrub pa'i rjes su bstan pas so //
translated: This verse ‚ÄúFrom that, the animals are killed‚Äù is a verse of commitment, because it teaches the proof.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma'i rtags kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma'i rtags kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Here, the sign of the cause and effect of the collection is considered.

original: chos kyi rgyu ni phyugs rnams gsod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyu ni phyugs rnams gsod pa'o //
translated: The cause of the Dharma is killing the animals.

original: de ni mi rigs pa khas len pa ste 'dis ni lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i 'bras bu de yang mi rigs pa nyid du dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs pa khas len pa ste 'dis ni lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i 'bras bu de yang mi rigs pa nyid du dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is an unreasonable commitment. This says that birth in the world of the gods is the effect of birth, and that is also committed to as unreasonable.

original: lha mnyes pa'i ched du zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs pa nyid du dam bca' ba yin te /
analyzed: lha mnyes pa'i ched du zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs pa nyid du dam bca' ba yin te /
translated: For the sake of pleasing the gods is also committed to as unreasonable.

original: phyugs rnams bsad pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni ji ltar mchod sbyin pa de dag phyugs rnams bsad pa chos nyid du rigs par ston par byed de /
analyzed: phyugs rnams bsad pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni ji ltar mchod sbyin pa de dag phyugs rnams bsad pa chos nyid du rigs par ston par byed de /
translated: This verse ‚ÄúThe animals are killed‚Äù teaches that killing the animals is reasonable as the nature of the sacrifice.

original: de mi rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smras so //
analyzed: de mi rigs pa'i dbang du byas nas phyugs rnams bsad pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smras so //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúThey kill the animals in the sacrifice‚Äù is stated from the perspective of the impropriety of that.

original: sngags kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mchod sbyin pa de dag phyugs bsad pa nyi tshes ni chos nyid du mi ston te 'on kyang sngags kyi mthu dang ldan pas bsad na ni mtho ris su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: sngags kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mchod sbyin pa de dag phyugs bsad pa nyi tshes ni chos nyid du mi ston te 'on kyang sngags kyi mthu dang ldan pas bsad na ni mtho ris su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the power of mantra‚Äù means that the sacrificers do not teach that killing animals in a sacrifice is a natural law. However, if one kills by the power of mantra, one goes to the higher realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngags kyi mthus bsad na de yang rgyu sbyor ba dang mngon par mtho ba la sbyor ba'i byed pa po dang / gsad par bya ba nyid kyis mtho ris kyi rgyu yin pas gzhan gyi kha na ma tho ba med cing bde ba dang phan pa la 'jug pa'i chos te /
analyzed: sngags kyi mthus bsad na de yang rgyu sbyor ba dang mngon par mtho ba la sbyor ba'i byed pa po dang / gsad par bya ba nyid kyis mtho ris kyi rgyu yin pas gzhan gyi kha na ma tho ba med cing bde ba dang phan pa la 'jug pa'i chos te /
translated: If one kills by the power of mantra, that is a Dharma that is free of the misdeed of others and is engaged in for the sake of happiness and benefit because it is the cause of the higher realms through the activity of the person who applies the cause and the object to be killed.

original: chos de ni lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyu'o //üîΩsngags kyi mthus @213a * //
analyzed: chos de ni lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyu'o // sngags kyi mthus @213a * //
translated: That Dharma is the cause of rebirth in the world of the gods.

original: bsad pa'i phyugs mtho ris su 'gro bag las she na /
analyzed: bsad pa'i phyugs mtho ris su 'gro bag las she na /
translated: How do the animals killed by the power of mantra go to the higher realms?

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyis gzhan gyi 'bras bur smin cing ster ba mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyis gzhan gyi 'bras bur smin cing ster ba mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the result of an action done by one person ripens and is given to another person.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi sems kyis byas pa ni byed pa po de nyid la dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi sems kyis byas pa ni byed pa po de nyid la dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The mind of another person‚Äôs continuum does not create the action. That agent himself has virtue and nonvirtue.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin te ;
translated: It is not the other person.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsad pa dang de nyid du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsad pa dang de nyid du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between the killing and that person.

original: bsad pa dang de chos dang mthun pa yin pa la /
analyzed: bsad pa dang de chos dang mthun pa yin pa la /
translated: If the killing were connected with that person,

original: bsad pa 'bras bu dang ldan par gyur na yang bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba de med pas de yang med do //
analyzed: bsad pa 'bras bu dang ldan par gyur na yang bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba de med pas de yang med do //
translated: then even if the killing were to have a result, that person would not be born in the divine world.

original: don 'di nyid sgrub pa'i phyir log par spyod pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid sgrub pa'i phyir log par spyod pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: In order to establish this point, the verse ‚ÄúBecause of wrong conduct‚Äù is stated.

original: gzhan gyis bsad pa'i phyugs mtho ris su mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsad pa'i phyugs mtho ris su mi 'gro ste /
translated: Cattle killed by another person do not go to the higher realms.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no sign of virtue or nonvirtue in either the intention or the application.

original: log par spyod pas yid ni ma bzlog cing //
analyzed: log par spyod pas yid ni ma bzlog cing //
translated: And the mind is not turned away from wrong conduct.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdig pa las ldog pa med pa bstan pa ste bsam pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdig pa las ldog pa med pa bstan pa ste bsam pas so //
translated: This shows the absence of turning away from evil, by intention.

original: dge ba'i las la nges par ma byas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i las la nges par ma byas pa //
translated: And not definitely engaged in virtuous karma.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis dge ba la 'jug pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis dge ba la 'jug pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows the absence of engagement in virtue by both intention and application.

original: sems pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of intention:

original: kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par sems pa dang tshol ba'o ;
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par sems pa dang tshol ba'o ;
translated: intention as universal, intention as definite, and intention as seeking.

original: / kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par sems pas bskyod pa'i sems kyis las nges par byed pa nyid na /
analyzed: / kun tu sbyor ba dang / nges par sems pas bskyod pa'i sems kyis las nges par byed pa nyid na /
translated: When karma is definitely performed by a mind that is moved by intention as universal and intention as definite,

original: 'dis ni de dag med pas sbyor ba med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de dag med pas sbyor ba med par bstan te /
translated: this shows the absence of application due to the absence of those two.

original: dge ba'i mtshams sbyor ba med par bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: dge ba'i mtshams sbyor ba med par bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the method of showing the absence of the connection with virtue.

original: yang na phyugs ni mtho ris su mi 'gro ste ;
analyzed: yang na phyugs ni mtho ris su mi 'gro ste ;
translated: Or, cattle do not go to the higher realms

original: rang gis byas pa'i dge ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i dge ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the virtue that is self-produced.

original: dge ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two kinds of virtue:

original: ldog pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ldog pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: that which has the characteristic of turning away from evil and that which has the characteristic of engagement.

original: mi dge ba dag las ldog pa ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba dag las ldog pa ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis so //
translated: The opposite of nonvirtue is by both intention and application.

original: dge ba dag la 'jug pa la yang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba dag la 'jug pa la yang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gnyis kyis so //
translated: And the engagement in virtue is also by both intention and application.

original: yid nges pa zhes bya bas ni mi dge ba las bsam pas log pa med pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i bsam pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: yid nges pa zhes bya bas ni mi dge ba las bsam pas log pa med pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i bsam pa med par bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a definite mind‚Äù shows that there is no reversal of intention from nonvirtue and no intention to engage in virtue.

original: de med ba las dge ba las ldog pa'i sbyor ba med pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba med par bstan to //
analyzed: de med ba las dge ba las ldog pa'i sbyor ba med pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba med par bstan to //
translated: The absence of that shows the absence of application to the reversal from virtue and the absence of application to engagement in virtue.

original: bsam pa sdon  @213b du 'gro bas dge ba dang mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa sdon  @213b du 'gro bas dge ba dang mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, intention precedes engagement in virtue and nonvirtue and reversal from them.

original: phyugs mtho ris su 'gro ba de mi rigs pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyugs mtho ris su 'gro ba de mi rigs pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that it is illogical for cattle to go to the higher realms,

original: mchod sbyin la bsad ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la bsad ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse ‚ÄúWhen killed in sacrifice‚Äù is stated.

original: phyugs su zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyugs dag mchod sbyin du bsad pa de bzhin du khyed bdag nyid gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyugs su zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyugs dag mchod sbyin du bsad pa de bzhin du khyed bdag nyid gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCattle‚Äù means that just as cattle are killed in sacrifice, so you kill yourselves.

original: mchod sbyin la ni tshul 'di yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la ni tshul 'di yin te /
translated: This is the way of sacrifice,

original: bdag nyid gsod pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bdag nyid gsod pa'i tshul lo //
translated: the way of killing oneself.

original: de phyir de dag tshig ni su zhig nyan //
analyzed: de phyir de dag tshig ni su zhig nyan //
translated: Therefore, who would listen to their words?

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du ni mi byed na ni tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad smras pa de bzhin du ni mi byed na ni tshig btsun par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if one does not act in accordance with what is said, one's words will not be respected.

original: de ltar lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba mi rigs par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba mi rigs par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that rebirth in the world of the gods is unreasonable,

original: bstan ma thag pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis lha mnyes par 'gyur ba nyid du mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis lha mnyes par 'gyur ba nyid du mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that it is unreasonable for the gods to be pleased,

original: mtshungs med mthu bsung zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: mtshungs med mthu bsung zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: he says the verse Unequalled power and fragrance.

original: bsung nyid mthu yin pas mthu bsung ngo //
analyzed: bsung nyid mthu yin pas mthu bsung ngo //
translated: Power is fragrance, so it is power and fragrance.

original: mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ni mtshungs med mthu bsung ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ni mtshungs med mthu bsung ldan pa'o //
translated: Power, fragrance, taste, and brilliance are unequalled power and fragrance.

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ldan pa'i bdud rtsi gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa med pa'i mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ldan pa'i bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ldan pa'i bdud rtsi gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa med pa'i mthu bsung dang / ro dang / gzi ldan pa'i bdud rtsi'o //
translated: That nectar which has incomparable power, fragrance, taste, and potency is the incomparable power, fragrance, taste, and potency of nectar.

original: zas mchog ni gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: zas mchog ni gtsang ba'o //
translated: The supreme food is pure.

original: lha mos phul ba zhes bya ba ni lha mo mchog gis phul ba'i yid du 'ong ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: lha mos phul ba zhes bya ba ni lha mo mchog gis phul ba'i yid du 'ong ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The offering of the goddess shows that it is pleasing, offered by the supreme goddess.

original: de ltar gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown to be the antidote to the three faults.

original: mtshungs med mthu bsung ro dang gzi ldan pa //
analyzed: mtshungs med mthu bsung ro dang gzi ldan pa //
translated: Incomparable power, fragrance, taste, and potency

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par med pa'o //
translated: shows that it is without distinction.

original: phyugs bsad sha khrag ces bya ba bstan pa la mchod sbyin la phyugs kyi shas rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyugs bsad sha khrag ces bya ba bstan pa la mchod sbyin la phyugs kyi shas rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The killing of cattle, flesh, and blood shows that it is not suitable for sacrifice.

original: stsogs pa smos pa ni gang der sbyin pa gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pa ni gang der sbyin pa gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes other gifts there.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i zas 'di'i gnyen pos phyugs bsad sha khrag ces bya ba bstan pa dang / lha rnams mgu bar 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni gang sngar bstan pa'i mchod sbyin legs par bgyis pas lha mnyes na zhes bya ba de mi rigs par bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i zas 'di'i gnyen pos phyugs bsad sha khrag ces bya ba bstan pa dang / lha rnams mgu bar 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni gang sngar bstan pa'i mchod sbyin legs par bgyis pas lha mnyes na zhes bya ba de mi rigs par bstan to //
translated: The remedy for such a type of food is indicated by the words ‚Äúslaughtering cattle, flesh and blood,‚Äù and by the words ‚Äúpleasing the gods‚Äù it is shown that it is not right to please the gods by means of the well-performed sacrifice indicated above.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang gi phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with helpfulness‚Äù means that

original: khyed cag gis nga la rjes su bzung ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gis nga la rjes su bzung ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: you have been helpful to me.

original: des na rjes su bzung ba yin pas phan 'dogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su bzung ba yin pas phan 'dogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since you have been helpful, I am endowed with helpfulness.

original: @214a * // bag med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa gang yin pa de ni bag med pa'i gnyid kyis ma log pa ste /
analyzed: @214a * // bag med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa gang yin pa de ni bag med pa'i gnyid kyis ma log pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot asleep in heedless sleep‚Äù means not asleep in heedless sleep.

original: bag med pa'i gnyid kyis ma log cing dri ma med pa des so //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnyid kyis ma log cing dri ma med pa des so //
translated: With that stainlessness, not asleep in heedless sleep,

original: rtog chen nyid mig yin pas rtog chen mig go //
analyzed: rtog chen nyid mig yin pas rtog chen mig go //
translated: ‚Äúgreat thought‚Äù is the eye, so ‚Äúgreat thought eye.‚Äù

original: rang gi yul kho na la mthun pa'i chos kyis thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: rang gi yul kho na la mthun pa'i chos kyis thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of inference is obtained by the Dharma that is in agreement with its own object.

original: ga la bgyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshul 'di'i don ni bdag gis mi shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ga la bgyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshul 'di'i don ni bdag gis mi shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is it? means I do not understand the meaning of this method of inference.

original: dam pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i mchog ni legs pa'i tshad ma'i nang na tshad ma'i mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i mchog ni legs pa'i tshad ma'i nang na tshad ma'i mchog go //
translated: The supreme valid cognition of the noble ones is the supreme valid cognition among good valid cognitions.

original: skye bo mang pos mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo la bstan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang pos mthong bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo la bstan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having been seen by many people means having been shown to people.

original: sdig pa byed pa'i mi rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa'i skye po gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i mi rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa'i skye po gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to seize sinful people means in order to seize sinful people.

original: brtan zhing gtsang ma tshul khrims nor ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtan zhing gtsang ma tshul khrims nor ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Firm, pure, and possessing the wealth of morality means:

original: brtan pa'i tshul khrims ni rgyun du bsrung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: brtan pa'i tshul khrims ni rgyun du bsrung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Firm morality is because it is always protected.

original: / gtsang ma ni gus par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gtsang ma ni gus par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure is because it is done with respect.

original: de nyid nor yin te /
analyzed: de nyid nor yin te /
translated: That itself is wealth.

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it accomplishes the desired goal.

original: gang de lta bu de nyid ni mi mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: gang de lta bu de nyid ni mi mchog ces brjod do //
translated: That is what is called the supreme human.

original: stong gis zhes bya ba ni stong phrag du ma'o //
analyzed: stong gis zhes bya ba ni stong phrag du ma'o //
translated: By the thousands means by many thousands.

original: tshul ma yin pa'i rjes su spyod pa de brnyes pa ni tshul min rjes spyod brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa'i rjes su spyod pa de brnyes pa ni tshul min rjes spyod brnyes pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the practice of what is improper is the attainment of the practice of what is improper.

original: de bas na sdig pa byed pa'i mi bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzung ba mchog tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sdig pa byed pa'i mi bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzung ba mchog tu byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to seize the person who commits evil, means to make the seizure supreme.

original: tshul khrims dang sdom pa yang dag par blang ba la ni 'bad ces bya ba ni tshul khrims nyid sdom pa yin pas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'o //

analyzed: mngon sum 'dul ba bzhin du skye dgu rnams la phan 'dogs par gyur to zhes bstan pa de'i dbang du byas nas //

original: 'jig rten phan pa chos ldan de mthong nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten phan pa chos ldan de mthong nas //
translated: Having seen the worldly person who is virtuous and helpful,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
translated: the verse is:

original: ldan pa ni de dang ldan bas na ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni de dang ldan bas na ldan pa'o //
translated: He is helpful, because he is endowed with that.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i phan pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i phan pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: That which is helpful and endowed with virtue is worldly.

original: chos dang ldan pa ni rtse gcig tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ni rtse gcig tu spyod pa ste /
translated: Endowed with virtue means practicing one-pointedly.

original: chos nyid 'ba' zhig spyod ces pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid 'ba' zhig spyod ces pa'o //
translated: It means practicing only reality.

original: chos kyi lam ni chos kyi lam nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi lam ni chos kyi lam nyid do //
translated: The path of Dharma is the very path of Dharma.

original: chos kyi lam 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi lam 'dul ba ste /
translated: The path of Dharma is the Vinaya.

original: des bskyed pa'i chos kyi lam gang thob pa'o //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i chos kyi lam gang thob pa'o //
translated: The path of Dharma that is generated by that is obtained.

original: chos de la gnod pa byas pa ni 'dul ba la gnod pa byas pas na chos la gnod pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos de la gnod pa byas pa ni 'dul ba la gnod pa byas pas na chos la gnod pa byas pa'o //
translated: One who injures that Dharma injures the Vinaya, and thus injures the Dharma.

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i rim pa bzhin du nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i rim pa bzhin du nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: The order in which they are taught is the order in which they are explained.

original: gsum po 'di dag gis ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gnyi ga la phan par 'jug pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /üîΩsngar bstan pa @225a * //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag gis ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gnyi ga la phan par 'jug pa'i dbang du byas pa ste / sngar bstan pa @225a * //
translated: These three are from the point of view of engaging in benefit for both this world and the next.

original: bzhin du rim pas dgod do //
analyzed: bzhin du rim pas dgod do //
translated: They are set forth in order, as previously explained.

original: dpal mo gzugs dang ldan pa bzhin //
analyzed: dpal mo gzugs dang ldan pa bzhin //
translated: Like the glorious beauty.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzi mdangs mchog dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzi mdangs mchog dang ldan pas so //
translated: This means that she has the most radiant beauty.

original: dga' ba mngon sum du gyur pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni blta na rab tu sdug pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba mngon sum du gyur pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni blta na rab tu sdug pas so //
translated: Like one who has actualized joy. This means that she is very lovely to behold.

original: lha mo bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bud med rin po cher gyur pas so //
analyzed: lha mo bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bud med rin po cher gyur pas so //
translated: Like a goddess. This means that she is a precious woman.

original: rgyu 'di gsum gyis ni gzugs mdzes shing bzang bar blta'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'di gsum gyis ni gzugs mdzes shing bzang bar blta'o //
translated: By these three causes, she is beautiful and good looking.

original: mthong na yid ni 'phrog pa mi'i rigs las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mthong na yid ni 'phrog pa mi'i rigs las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: She is a woman who is captivating to the mind, and who is completely beyond the human race.

original: bud med rin po cher bkur ba bzhin du gyur par bshad do //
analyzed: bud med rin po cher bkur ba bzhin du gyur par bshad do //
translated: She is explained to be like the precious woman.

original: ji srid ces bya ba 'dis dus dang yul gzung ste /
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba 'dis dus dang yul gzung ste /
translated: Here, as long as refers to time and place.

original: khyad par sems dang 'brel par ston pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyad par sems dang 'brel par ston pa nyid de /
translated: It is just showing that the special [woman] is connected with the mind.

original: de'i lus dus dang yul gang la mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi dus dang / de srid kyi yul lta ba zlog par nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lus dus dang yul gang la mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi dus dang / de srid kyi yul lta ba zlog par nus pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no ability to stop the view of the body for as long as the time and place of seeing it.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang mthong ba rnams kyi lta bzlog par mi nus pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang mthong ba rnams kyi lta bzlog par mi nus pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: Therefore is the cause of not being able to stop the view of those who see.

original: myos par byed pas na myos byed ma zhes bya bar btags te ming gi yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: myos par byed pas na myos byed ma zhes bya bar btags te ming gi yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: It is called intoxicating because it intoxicates, and it is designated as such. This is the teaching of the qualities of the name.

original: 'das pa ni rigs par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni rigs par gsol ba'o //
translated: The past tense is used in I request.

original: ji ltar gsol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsol zhe na /
translated: How is it requested?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lha khyod kyi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lha khyod kyi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that, it says your object, god, and so on.

original: na zhes bya ba ni bud med rin po che yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni bud med rin po che yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The na is the precious woman.

original: mig dang yid la dbang yang med par gyur //
analyzed: mig dang yid la dbang yang med par gyur //
translated: He had no control over his eyes and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i gdong du mig mi 'dzums par lta bas mig la dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i gdong du mig mi 'dzums par lta bas mig la dbang med pa'o //
translated: He had no control over his eyes because he stared at her face without blinking.

original: yid la dbang yang med par gyur pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bag chags phrogs pa yin te ;
analyzed: yid la dbang yang med par gyur pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bag chags phrogs pa yin te ;
translated: He had no control over his mind because he was robbed of the latent tendencies that follow the Dharma,

original: mi brtan par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtan par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he became unstable.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: mig la dbang byed pas lus mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi dus dang yul yid la dbang byed par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mig la dbang byed pas lus mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi dus dang yul yid la dbang byed par gyur pa ste /
translated: As long as he had control over his eyes, he saw the body, and for that long he had control over his mind and place.

original: 'dod pas myos nas 'du shes nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas myos nas 'du shes nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: But intoxicated with desire, his perception was impaired.

original: mig lam du mi snang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: mig lam du mi snang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin te /
translated: He did not appear in the path of the eyes means that it is consistent with what was explained before.

original: 'dod chags ma bral ba yis zhes bya ba de'i tshigs bcad kyis so //
analyzed: 'dod chags ma bral ba yis zhes bya ba de'i tshigs bcad kyis so //
translated: By the verse By one who is not free from desire...

original: chos dang srid ni chos dang srid do //
analyzed: chos dang srid ni chos dang srid do //
translated: Dharma and artha are Dharma and artha.

original: srid kyi don yang yin la sgrub pa yang yin pas srid kyi don sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: srid kyi don yang yin la sgrub pa yang yin pas srid kyi don sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since it is both the aim of existence and accomplishment, it is the accomplishment of the aim of existence.

original: chos dang srid de gnyis kyi @225b don sgrub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos dang srid de gnyis kyi @225b don sgrub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The accomplishment of the aim of both Dharma and existence is as follows:

original: srid kyi don sgrub pa ni nor bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: srid kyi don sgrub pa ni nor bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The accomplishment of the aim of existence is the accomplishment of wealth.

original: nor sgrub pa ni ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / thob pa yongs su bsrung ba dang / bsrungs pa rab tu 'phel bar bya'o //
analyzed: nor sgrub pa ni ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / thob pa yongs su bsrung ba dang / bsrungs pa rab tu 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: The accomplishment of wealth is the attainment of what has not been attained, the protection of what has been attained, and the increase of what has been protected.

original: chos kyi don sgrub pa ni stegs lam rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don sgrub pa ni stegs lam rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the aim of Dharma is the accomplishment of the path of the vehicle.

original: rgyal po'i don sgrub pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos sgrub pa'i don te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i don sgrub pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos sgrub pa'i don te /
translated: The accomplishments of the king are the aims to be accomplished by the king.

original: bzhi po de dag ni rgyal po'i don sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni rgyal po'i don sgrub pa'o //
translated: These four are the accomplishments of the king.

original: sgrub pa de'i dus las yol ba ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa de'i dus las yol ba ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The transgression of the time of that accomplishment is the past.

original: phan pa dang bde ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'o //
translated: Benefit and happiness are benefit and happiness.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: Arising is birth.

original: de ni lam ni skye ba'i lam yin pas phan pa dang bde ba 'byung ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de ni lam ni skye ba'i lam yin pas phan pa dang bde ba 'byung ba'i lam mo //
translated: That is the path of the arising of benefit and happiness.

original: rgyal po'i don sgrub pa las yol ba de ni 'bangs rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i lam chad de phung bar 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //üîΩ'di ni mthong ba tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: rgyal po'i don sgrub pa las yol ba de ni 'bangs rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i lam chad de phung bar 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o // 'di ni mthong ba tsam gyis ni //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang yul mngon sum du gyur pas kyang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang yul mngon sum du gyur pas kyang ste /
translated: The phrase merely by seeing means that even when the object is directly perceived.

original: 'dis ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the restraint of the sense faculties.

original: drang srong rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thub pa'o //
analyzed: drang srong rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thub pa'o //
translated: The phrase even the sages means those who have conquered the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa rgyu gsum po tshang bas ni nyon mongs pa rnams dus res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa rgyu gsum po tshang bas ni nyon mongs pa rnams dus res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The afflictions arise from time to time when the three causes are complete: the non-eradication of the latent afflictions, incorrect mental activity, etc.

original: yul rgya cher mngon sum du gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / bag chags ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: yul rgya cher mngon sum du gyur pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / bag chags ma spangs pa ste /
translated: The three causes are the direct perception of extensive objects, incorrect mental activity, and the non-eradication of latent tendencies.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul 'di nye bar gnas pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed pas //üîΩnyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
analyzed: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul 'di nye bar gnas pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed pas // nyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
translated: The causes of the afflictions are: not abandoning the proclivity, the presence of the object, and improper mental activity.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The afflictions arise from the presence of all the causes.

original: 'dod chags can gyi mig lta zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis gong ma las bzlog pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags can gyi mig lta zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis gong ma las bzlog pa bstan to //
translated: The first half of the verse on ‚Äúthe eyes of the lustful‚Äù teaches the opposite of the above.

original: 'dod chags can gyi mig ces pas ni dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / bag chags yang dag par ma spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags can gyi mig ces pas ni dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / bag chags yang dag par ma spangs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eyes of the lustful‚Äù means the sense doors are not guarded and the traces are not completely abandoned.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba 'dis tshul bzhin yid la byad pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba 'dis tshul bzhin yid la byad pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe king‚Äù means improper mental activity.

original: rang dbang du gyur pas tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang du gyur pas tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Since one is not independent, improper mental activity is not averted.

original: bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe pleasant abiding‚Äù means the object is present.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i rgyu tshang bar gyur pas so //üîΩnyon mongs @226a * //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i rgyu tshang bar gyur pas so // nyon mongs @226a * //
translated: Thus, the afflictions arise from the presence of all the causes.

original: pa rnams ni sems rang dbang du gyur pa las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: pa rnams ni sems rang dbang du gyur pa las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: The afflictions arise from the mind being independent.

original: sngar bstan pa thams cad 'di las 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa thams cad 'di las 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: All that has been taught previously is shown to arise from this.

original: yang na don gzhan du na nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyu bzhis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na don gzhan du na nyon mongs pa rnams ni rgyu bzhis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Alternatively, the afflictions arise from four causes:

original: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / de ni yul mngon du gyur pa dang / yid la byed pas de la lta ba dang / rgas pas ni mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / de ni yul mngon du gyur pa dang / yid la byed pas de la lta ba dang / rgas pas ni mi nus pa ste /
translated: the sense gate is not guarded, the object is present, the attention is directed toward it, and the person is in a state of weakness.

original: de la nus pa ma tshang bas so //
analyzed: de la nus pa ma tshang bas so //
translated: The person is in a state of weakness because the capacity is incomplete.

original: nang yang gzung ste /
analyzed: nang yang gzung ste /
translated: The internal is also grasped.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of that.

original: gzhan dbang yang rang la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dbang yang rang la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other-dependent is also due to the absence of capacity in itself.

original: de la 'dod chags can gyi mig gis lta zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis ni de las bzlog pa la yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags can gyi mig gis lta zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis ni de las bzlog pa la yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the context of the lustful one looks with the eye, it does not occur in the opposite case.

original: skabs zhig tu zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skabs zhig tu zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: At some time is from the perspective of a particular state.

original: grags pa med pa byed pa dang / rang gi dge ba log par spyod pa'i skyon gyis 'byor pa med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: grags pa med pa byed pa dang / rang gi dge ba log par spyod pa'i skyon gyis 'byor pa med par byed pa ste /
translated: The fault of engaging in one's own virtue without resources is made.

original: khyim thab kyi dge mtshan ngan pas phun sum tshogs pa'i bgegs su gyur pas so //
analyzed: khyim thab kyi dge mtshan ngan pas phun sum tshogs pa'i bgegs su gyur pas so //
translated: The misfortune of the husband is an obstacle to the perfection of the wife.

original: smad pa ni mtshan dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa ni mtshan dang bral ba'o //
translated: The disgrace is the absence of the auspicious signs.

original: mdzes pa med par byed pa ni zla ba sprin rum du nub pas gnam sa'i bye brag mi mdzes par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mdzes pa med par byed pa ni zla ba sprin rum du nub pas gnam sa'i bye brag mi mdzes par byed pa yin te /
translated: The lack of beauty is the lack of distinction between heaven and earth, because the moon has set behind a cloud.

original: gnam dang sa gnyis kyi bye brag med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnam dang sa gnyis kyi bye brag med par byed pa'o //
translated: The lack of distinction is the lack of distinction between heaven and earth.

original: nga'i rigs dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan ngan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i rigs dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan ngan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lack of conformity with my family is because of his lack of auspicious signs.

original: re zhig rigs dang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bsams te de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rim gyis zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: re zhig rigs dang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bsams te de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rim gyis zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Thinking he will conform to my family, the king, after some time, gradually, not immediately,

original: blon bo de la phyin ma thag pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde bas na 'di ltar ston pa ste /üîΩde'i che ni rgyal pos mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang med de /
analyzed: blon bo de la phyin ma thag pa ni ma yin te / de bas na 'di ltar ston pa ste / de'i che ni rgyal pos mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang med de /
translated: having seen the minister,üîΩ says he is not suitable for my daughter.

original: bag ma sar par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag ma sar par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The king does not even have the stage of seeing the path, because he is a newlywed.

original: bdag rang gi grong khyer mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal po de'i ku mu ta'i dga' ston lta ba ni skyon med pa yin te /üîΩde lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rang gi grong khyer mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal po de'i ku mu ta'i dga' ston lta ba ni skyon med pa yin te / de lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.

original: ku mu ta'i dga' ston ma yin pa gzhan du na brkam chags can du 'gyur te /üîΩde yongs su bcad pa'i phyir mchog ces smos so //
analyzed: ku mu ta'i dga' ston ma yin pa gzhan du na brkam chags can du 'gyur te / de yongs su bcad pa'i phyir mchog ces smos so //
translated: The festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.

original: bltas rung ba'i phyir ni ku mu ta'i dga' ston bstan to //üîΩphyag dar byas shing chag chag btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkyang pas ni mig dang / rna ba @226b dang ; sna'i dbang po'i yul phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: bltas rung ba'i phyir ni ku mu ta'i dga' ston bstan to // phyag dar byas shing chag chag btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkyang pas ni mig dang / rna ba @226b dang ; sna'i dbang po'i yul phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: The festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.üîΩThe festival of the kumuta flowers is the festival of the kumuta flowers.

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de ni brjed par bdag 'dod na //

analyzed: de ni brjed par 'dod pa la //

analyzed: chas shing 'greng dang lta ba la //
